sen.j: 新三十六歌仙（しん-さんじゅうろく／っ-かせん）は歌人に関する名数の一種。
sen.e: New thirty-six major poets is a name given to call certain distinguished poets.
New thirty-six major poets is the name given to certain distinguished poets.
New thirty-six major poets is the name given to certain distinguished poets.

sen.j: またその秀歌を集めた集の名。
sen.e: It also refers to the name of the collection in which their excellent poems were compiled.
It also refers to the name of the collection in which their excellent poems were compiled.
It also refers to the name of the collection in which their excellent poems were compiled.

sen.j: 藤原公任の撰にかかる三十六歌仙に倣って、重複なく新たに選ばれたもので、現在までに以下の二種確認されている。
sen.e: Following the example of the thirty-six major poets selected by FUJIWARA no Kinto, the new ones were selected avoiding overlapping, and so far there are two kinds of "new thirty-six major poets" as follows.

Following the example of the thirty-six major poets selected by FUJIWARA no Kinto, the new ones were selected with no overlapping, and so far there are two kinds of "new thirty-six major poets" as follows.

Following the example of the thirty-six major poets selected by FUJIWARA no Kinto, the new ones were selected with no overlapping, and so far there are two kinds of "new thirty-six major poets" as follows.

sen.j: 藤原基俊の撰によるもの。
sen.e: The ones selected by FUJIWARA no Mototoshi.
The ones selected by FUJIWARA no Mototoshi.
The ones selected by FUJIWARA no Mototoshi.

sen.j: 「新三十六人」として『八雲御抄』などに伝えるが、散逸。
sen.e: Their names were handed down in the book of "Yakumomisho" under the group of 'New Thirty-six Poets,' but the pages were dispersed and lost.
Their names were handed down in the book of Yakumomisho under the group of 'New Thirty-six Poets', but the pages were dispersed and lost.
Their names were handed down in the book of "Yakumomisho" under the group of 'New Thirty-six Poets,' but the pages were dispersed and lost.

sen.j: 撰者不明。
sen.e: The ones by unknown selectors.
The ones by unknown selectors.
The ones by unknown selectors.

sen.j: 『新編国歌大観』等に所収の鎌倉時代の歌人を中心としたもの。
sen.e: This ones were mainly from the poets whose poems were collected in "A New Version of Comprehensive National Poems" in the Kamakura period.
These ones were mainly from the poets whose poems were collected in A New Version of Comprehensive National Poems in the Kamakura period.
These ones were mainly from the poets whose poems were collected in "A New Version of Comprehensive National Poems" in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 2は後鳥羽院より藤原秀能まで、新古今期以降鎌倉時中期までの代表的歌人三十六人を挙げ、その秀歌を十首ずつ選んだものであり、通常「新三十六歌仙」といえばこれを指す。
sen.e: Generally speaking, 'new thirty-six major poets' refers to the latter ones which cover the representative thirty-six poets after Shin Kokin (New Collection of Ancient and Modern Poetry) until the middle of the Kamakura period such as Gotoba In and FUJIWARA no Hideyoshi/Hideto, and each poet's ten excellent poems were selected.
sen.cmt: ウィキペディアを参照したところ、原文中の「２は」は、撰者不明の新三十六歌仙を指していたため、「後者の新三十六歌仙は後鳥羽院より･･･」と読み替えて訳しました。
sen.e: Generally speaking, 'new thirty-six major poets' refers to the latter ones which cover the representative thirty-six poets after Shin Kokin (New Collection of Ancient and Modern Poetry) until the middle of the Kamakura period such as Gotoba In and FUJIWARA no Hideyoshi/Hideto, and each poet's ten excellent poems were selected.

Generally speaking, 'new thirty-six major poets' refers to the latter ones which cover the representative thirty-six poets after Shin Kokin (New Collection of Ancient and Modern Poetry) until the middle of the Kamakura period such as Gotoba in and FUJIWARA no Hideyoshi/Hideto, and each poet's ten excellent poems were selected.

sen.j: 成立年次は不明だが、宗尊親王を「鎌倉宮」としているところから、将軍宣下（建長四年、1252年）以降に成ったものと推測される。
sen.e: It is unknown when the thirty-six poets were selected, but Prince Munetaka was called 'Kamakura Prince' in the book, which suggests that they were designated after appointment to Shogun in 1252.
It is unknown when the thirty-six poets were selected, but Prince Munetaka was called 'Kamakura Prince' in the book, which suggests that they were designated after his appointment to Shogun in 1252.

It is unknown when the thirty-six poets were selected, but Imperial Prince Munetaka was called 'Kamakura Prince' in the book, which suggests that they were designated after his appointment to Shogun in 1252.
